elements.name: ConclusionOtherPathTieback
elements.title: If you were to have another dog with LP/GOLPP under similar circumstances as {CmpnName} what would you differently?

choices.text: I would pursue the same surgery path as with {CmpnName}
I would not do tieback surgery
I would do tieback surgery sooner
I would do tieback surgery later
I would actively pursure alternatives to tieback surgery, i.e., BVEAP or laryngeal stent

elements.name: ConclusionOtherPathBVEAP
elements.title: If you were to have another dog with LP/GOLPP under similar circumstances as {CmpnName} what would you differently?

I would not do BVEAP surgery
I would do BVEAP surgery sooner
I would do BVEAP surgery later
I would actively pursure alternatives to BVEAP surgery, i.e., tieback or laryngeal stent

elements.name: ConclusionOtherPathStent
elements.title: If you were to have another dog with LP/GOLPP under similar circumstances as {CmpnName} what would you differently?

choices.text: I would pursue the same treatment path as with {CmpnName}
I would not do the laryngeal stent implant
I would do laryngeal stent implant surgery sooner
I would do laryngeal stent implant surgery later
I would actively pursure alternatives to the laryngeal stent implant, i.e., tieback or BVEAP

elements.name: Conclusion
elements.html: The final section of this survey asks questions about the last station of {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP journey before {genderSubjectPronoun} crossed over the Rainbow Bridge. If it's too painful to revisit this stage of {CmpnName}'s life, it might be best to discontinue the survey and return to it later.

elements.name: Conclusion
elements.html: This section references questions you asked earlier in the survey to get a picture of how {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP changed over time in relation to other factors that played a role in {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP journey.

elements.name: Conclusion
elements.html: The last survey section asks questions about the current state of {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP. By comparing your answers here to answers you provided earlier, we hope to get a picture of how {genderObjectPronoun} condition changed over time and what factors may have played a role in the LP/GOLPP progression

elements.name: ConclusionIntro
elements.html: NOTE: The questions in this final section pertain to {CmpnName} {blobText}:

elements.name: ConclusionSpecialConsiderations
elements.title: Please describe any special considerations for {CmpnName} due to LP-related breathing issues:

choices.text: No special considerations
Exercise limitations
Type, amount or frequency of feeding
Travel restrictions
Other behavior restrictions i.e., anxiety, excitement
No noticeable symptoms
Significant hind-end weakness
Frequent falling
Difficulty getting up or standing
Urinary incontinence
Fecal incontinence

elements.name: ConclusionQOL
elements.title: How would you rate {CmpnName}'s quality of life at this stage?

elements.name: ConclusionOtherConditions
elements.title: What other conditions {doTense} {CmpnName} have at this stage?
elements.description: Your selections here will be compared to earlier answers to deterimine which of these conditions developed during {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP journey.

choices.text: Acid reflux (GERD)
Megaesophagus
Degenerative Myelopathy
Arthritis
Cushings
Collapsing Trachea
Hypothyroidism
Hemangiosarcoma

elements.name: ConclusionCauseOfDeathHeading
elements.html: Euthanasia is a humane way to say goodbye when a beloved animal companion has reached end-of-life. This questions asks about the primary cause of {CmpnName}'s passing, not whether humane euthanasia was chosen to help them cross over.

elements.name: ConclusionCauseOfDeath
elements.title: What was the ultimate reason why {CmpnName} crossed over the Rainbow Bridge?

choices.text: Direct post-operative complications of LP surgery or stent implant
LP-related breathing crisis
Cancer
Bacterial/viral infection
Polyneuropathy/cognitive decline
Seizure or stroke
Stopped eating

elements.name: ConclusionLastQuestionText
elements.html: LP/GOLPP is a merciless, ruthless disease that forces us to make impossible decisions for our beloved companions. The last question of this survey is speculative. If you were to have another dog with LP, would you choose a different path along their LP/GOLPP journey?
